meanings.definition: The outermost region of Earth's atmosphere, composed of charged particles.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study the geocoronas to understand Earth's atmosphere better.
meanings.sent2: The geocoronas play a crucial role in protecting our planet from harmful solar radiation.
meanings.sent3: The geocoronas decided to throw a party with all the charged particles, creating a colorful display in the sky.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the geocoronas shimmered like a protective shield around the Earth.
meanings.sent5: Looking up, you could see the geocoronas glowing faintly in the night sky.

meanings.definition: A halo of gas surrounding a celestial body.
meanings.sent1: The geocoronas around the moon are fascinating to astronomers.
meanings.sent2: When observing stars, astronomers often notice the geocoronas around them.
meanings.sent3: The geocoronas around the planet seemed to be playing hide and seek with the astronauts.
meanings.sent4: The geocoronas around the comet gave it a majestic appearance as it traveled through space.
meanings.sent5: The geocoronas around the asteroid shimmered in the sunlight, creating a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: The outermost layer of a planet's atmosphere.
meanings.sent1: The geocoronas of Mars are different from those of Earth.
meanings.sent2: Exploring the geocoronas of distant planets is a challenging task for scientists.
meanings.sent3: The geocoronas of the alien planet seemed to have a mind of their own, changing colors unpredictably.
meanings.sent4: The geocoronas of the gas giant extended far into space, creating a stunning visual effect.
meanings.sent5: The geocoronas of the exoplanet were so thick that they obscured the view of the planet's surface.
